title: A typographic tradition of April Fools Day hoaxes
content:
Mr J Hoefler clearly [does not approve](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020224010/http:/www.typography.com/ask/showBlog.php?blogID=91), however the typographic community has [standards to uphold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020224010/http:/www.museumofhoaxes.com/hoax/Hoaxipedia/San_Serriffe/). I do not know if we are able to meet them, but try we must. Tradition in typography is important.

Discuss.
author: Si_Daniels
